tags: Repeat like a mantra: The Lannister woman shall never have this skin.
summary: Meanwhile in the Books: He left the room with his eyes burning and his daughter’s wails echoing in his ears, and found the...
body:
Meanwhile in the Books:

He left the room with his eyes burning and his daughter’s wails echoing in his ears, and found the direwolf pup where they chained her. Ned sat beside her for a while. “Lady,” he said, tasting the name. He had never paid much attention to the names the children had picked, but looking at her now, he knew that Sansa had chosen well. She was the smallest of the litter, the prettiest, the most gentle and trusting. She looked at him with bright golden eyes, and he ruffled her thick grey fur.

Shortly, Jory brought him Ice.

When it was over, he said, “Choose four men and have them take the body north. Bury her at Winterfell.”

“All that way?” Jory said, astonished.

“All that way,” Ned affirmed. “The Lannister woman shall never have this skin.”

—A Game of Thrones - Eddard III

summary: I am now accepting volunteers for Santa’s Little Helpers!
title: I am now accepting volunteers for Santa’s Little Helpers!
body:
If you want to become a Santa’s Little Helper all you have to do is send me a message. If you are interested in becoming an SLH then here is everything you need to know:

Santa’s Little Helpers are our beta-readers, our emergency last-minute prompt-adopters, the people who send random love to people who aren’t even their exchange partner just because of reasons. They are basically available to help in any way that is needed and help to send holiday cheer to everyone.

And when it comes to beta reading and prompt adaptation it is first comes, first serve. If someone is in need of a beta or a fic needs adopting then I’ll send out a message to everyone that volunteer and who ever replies first get to do it. 

If anyone has any questions don’t be afraid to ask me!

summary: ...So.” She looked up at him again, nearly overwhelmed by the masculinity of him in this close of quarters. “What happened last...
body:
…So.” She looked up at him again, nearly overwhelmed by the masculinity of him in this close of quarters. “What happened last night?”

“You got pissed.” He grinned.

“Obviously.” She grinned back. “I meant after that.”

“Well.” He leaned back against the counter again, coffee mug in his hands as he stared at her. “You told me your suspicions about Harry and about how boring he is in bed. You made sure to tell me, and anyone within ear shot, that you were a, and I’m quoting you here, a ‘sex goddess’ and a ‘femme fatal’.”

@nevermorered ’s new fic!!! 🔥🔥

Not a princess

https://archiveofourown.org/works/16642508/chapters/39018854

title: An Angel in Hellfire

by MaxBetta

When newly elected President of the Hellfire M.C. Sandor Clegane has a chance encounter with a stunning redhead, she shows him how fun it can be to give up control, if only for one night.

summary: Not a Princess
title: Not a Princess
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2QJlq3r

by Nevermore_red

Sansa began dating Harry at the urging of her parents, and because she wants to be the good girl they expect her to be, she tries her hardest to make the relationship work. Only, Harry is just…boring. He treats her like a fragile, innocent princess and refuses to try and spice things up. Sansa is tired of it all. Besides, how could she just accept boring and unfaithful Harry the Arse when someone like Sandor Clegane exists?

Words: 3735, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Sandor Clegane, Sansa Stark, Harrold Hardyng
  • Relationships: Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark, Harrold Hardyng/Sansa Stark, for a bit - Relationship
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Boring Relationship, Ending Relationship, drunk Sansa, No cheating, At least on Sansa’s part, Harry the Arse, Fluff, Angst? Maybe a little, Smut, Harry and Sansa aren’t the main pairing, SanSan Endgame, Harry is boring in the sack, Sansa wants some excitment, Sandor is exciting

summary: if you could change anything in sansa's arc (books or show), what would it be?
question: if you could change anything in sansa's arc (books or show), what would it be?
answer:
i want a few changes here and there, nothing drastic.

Books

  • the weird judgy tone in game of thrones should go because we’re dealing with an 11 year old here george
  • her chapters start in winterfell not the trident
  • sansa’s talents in diplomacy are highlighted more esp in acok
  • she was described as knowing how to play the high harp and bells as well as poetry. i want to see it george you lazy fuck (i’m just annoyed that we have so much food and armor description but not a lot about the arts)
  • sansa learns as much as she can about the vale without waiting for littlefinger’s ‘guidance’
  • more sansa and the faith of the seven. it’s her religion but like many pov chapters, she sounds oddly agnostic
  • more sansa interacting with the smallfolk. by this i don’t mean disguising herself and living among them but generally hearing their issues and trying to figure out their solutions
  • more sansa and jayne and beth. george underrates female relationships too much.

Show

  • bran was sansa’s favourite brother. they should have shown it better. 
  • jeyne should have existed. sansa’s even more isolated in the show than in the books
  • the ramsay storyline could have had some actual northern remembrance. sansa should have been the protagonist of the s5 winterfell storyline instead of ramsay. they should have written stannis gaining the support of northern houses when they learn the boltons have captured ned stark’s daughter. that should have been his death instead of dragging it out for another season
  • littlefinger should have been killed at the end of s6 by sansa alone (i don’t mean the actual executioning) but he was her antagonist after all. there would be no need to cheapen stark ties for his sake
  • more sansa-cersei interactions. more sansa-northern and vale lord interaction (they seem to living in winterfell so why not)
  • greater emphasis on sansa’s trauma and how it affects her

  • more sansa interacting with the smallfolk. by this i don’t mean disguising herself and living among them but generally hearing their issues and trying to figure out their solutions

  • bran was sansa’s favourite brother. they should have shown it better. 
  • jeyne should have existed. sansa’s even more isolated in the show than in the books
  • the ramsay storyline could have had some actual northern remembrance. sansa should have been the protagonist of the s5 winterfell storyline instead of ramsay. they should have written stannis gaining the support of northern houses when they learn the boltons have captured ned stark’s daughter. that should have been his death instead of dragging it out for another season
  • littlefinger should have been killed at the end of s6 by sansa alone (i don’t mean the actual executioning) but he was her antagonist after all. there would be no need to cheapen stark ties for his sake
  • more sansa-cersei interactions. more sansa-northern and vale lord interaction (they seem to living in winterfell so why not)
  • greater emphasis on sansa’s trauma and how it affects her

trail.content_raw:
i want a few changes here and there, nothing drastic.

Books

  • the weird judgy tone in game of thrones should go because we’re dealing with an 11 year old here george
  • her chapters start in winterfell not the trident
  • sansa’s talents in diplomacy are highlighted more esp in acok
  • she was described as knowing how to play the high harp and bells as well as poetry. i want to see it george you lazy fuck (i’m just annoyed that we have so much food and armor description but not a lot about the arts)
  • sansa learns as much as she can about the vale without waiting for littlefinger’s ‘guidance’
  • more sansa and the faith of the seven. it’s her religion but like many pov chapters, she sounds oddly agnostic
  • more sansa interacting with the smallfolk. by this i don’t mean disguising herself and living among them but generally hearing their issues and trying to figure out their solutions
  • more sansa and jayne and beth. george underrates female relationships too much.

Show

  • bran was sansa’s favourite brother. they should have shown it better. 
  • jeyne should have existed. sansa’s even more isolated in the show than in the books
  • the ramsay storyline could have had some actual northern remembrance. sansa should have been the protagonist of the s5 winterfell storyline instead of ramsay. they should have written stannis gaining the support of northern houses when they learn the boltons have captured ned stark’s daughter. that should have been his death instead of dragging it out for another season
  • littlefinger should have been killed at the end of s6 by sansa alone (i don’t mean the actual executioning) but he was her antagonist after all. there would be no need to cheapen stark ties for his sake
  • more sansa-cersei interactions. more sansa-northern and vale lord interaction (they seem to living in winterfell so why not)
  • greater emphasis on sansa’s trauma and how it affects her

i want a few changes here and there, nothing drastic.

  • sansa’s talents in diplomacy are highlighted more esp in acok
  • she was described as knowing how to play the high harp and bells as well as poetry. i want to see it george you lazy fuck (i’m just annoyed that we have so much food and armor description but not a lot about the arts)
  • sansa learns as much as she can about the vale without waiting for littlefinger’s ‘guidance’

  • more sansa interacting with the smallfolk. by this i don’t mean disguising herself and living among them but generally hearing their issues and trying to figure out their solutions

blog.name: cleverjonquil
blog.title: As strong as my lady mother
blog.description: Side blog for all my Sansa/Catelyn/Elia love. Critical of show!Dany but still like book!Dany. Tully Loyalist. Pro Northern Independence. Book Jon >>> Show Jon. I track #courtesyismyarmor and #daughterofrivers

tags: ps thanks for my very first ask pn this blog
(neither really but their fans will get mad if i don't)
summary: I think Sansa is the actual outcast. Arya/ Jon are said as outcasts, yet they have each other, loved, protected by Ned, and...
question: I think Sansa is the actual outcast. Arya/ Jon are said as outcasts, yet they have each other, loved, protected by Ned, and their siblings keep thinking of them. While, Sansa siblings keep calling her/ what she loves as stupid, Robb only regret of her because he can't sold her for alliance, Jon care/think more about Tyrion, when he got news of Sansa being forced to marry Tyrion, Ned didn't hire high harp teacher for Sansa as promised by Catelyn while he find the best sword teacher for Arya, etc.
answer:
I completely agree.

I don’t know where the general fandom gets the idea that Sansa was the spoiled queen bee of Winterfell everyone fawned over while Arya and Jon were punished daily for just existing. Compare how a grand total of 5 people liked her more than them vs how Jon is immediately put in leadership roles or how Arya is preferred by their brothers, father, servants, and made a lot of friends down South. Arya was the popular girl who fit in perfectly. (And it’s also interesting how they say Sansa isn’t Stark-y enough AND simultaneously is the jewel of WF who fit in perfectly lol, so which is it?)

Cat was closer to her, Jeyne and Beth were her bffs as they were the only kids her age who didn’t- y'know- mock her interests, Mordane preferred her (the hardworking student who didn’t make trouble? What teacher would like that?!), even Theon prefers her for shallow reasons. This is seen as despicable to some fans, because their faves are the ones entitled to everyone’s love! Even a handful of people who genuinely like her sweet personality is too many.

It’s actually thanks to Sansa being the first born that Arya gets so much freedom. As an oldest daughter, it’s expected of her to be the example, to excel in her studies and prepare for her role as a lady. She wasn’t given the privilege to be indulged as her little siblings. That’s a lot of pressure.

So mix that pressure to be perfect with the favoritism her relatives show each other over her and boom, insecurities. Girls seeking attention they didn’t get from neglectful (if loving) fathers will often turn to the wrong men (ie her romanticizing Joffrey and Sandor’s abuse). Where do you think her need for validation came from? Not Cat!

Speaking of Ned, I do love him but he unthinkingly threw her to the wolves lions. He let Bran and Arya get away with disobedience but lets her think she’s being punished by killing Lady when he didn’t have to then with no warning or explanation breaks off the best engagement she could ever have (but still never prepares her for being handed over to the Lannisters??) Do I doubt that Nedder Butter loved her? Of course not. But parents who let you down often do!

Sorry that turned into a rant but it’s a topic that really angers me on the fandom’s part in how they ignore or dismiss Sansa’s neglect and hurts me on Sansa’s. Like that scene where she runs in terror while her siblings have a warm moment together laughing, nobody caring enough to go give her a hug and tell her it was only jon. :( It feels at times that she cares more about them than they do her. But I can’t really add anything else, because you pretty much nailed it all.

tags: yes this is yet another Oberyn saves Sansa from King's Landing fic
summary: A killer and a thief  [Tags: Oberyn/Sansa, canon divergent au, murder, rescue]  “Whose blood is that?” Prince Oberyn asks...
body:
A killer and a thief

[Tags: Oberyn/Sansa, canon divergent au, murder, rescue]

“Whose blood is that?” Prince Oberyn asks tightly, his hands on her shoulders stopping her from running away. She was fleeing from the Red Keep’s rose garden when he caught her and now her legs are shaking so hard she fears she may collapse.

She shakes her head and folds her lips together but a noise still escapes, a panicked, animal noise.

“Sansa, whose is it?” he asks, his eyes piercing, his body taut. “Is it yours?” One of his hands moves her hair – which has already been tugged by far crueller hands out of its pins – to the side and he sucks in a harsh breath. “Who made these bruises?” he asks as she quivers, as he looks around sharply.

Her chest, her hands, are soaked with blood and now she can smell it and now she fears she might vomit from the shock and horror of what she has done.

She has been taking tea with Prince Oberyn and his paramour for three weeks now, he has been trying to take her into his confidence, trying to persuade her that she can trust him, that he wishes to help her. But he cannot help her now, no one can.

[read more]
